page.title: 14Recreation-Parks.(2)
page.content: Recently in the 70's a piece of waste land behind a large Council Housing Estate in Lower Tumble was cleared by the local residents and turned into a park for the children. It has a B.M.X. track, benches, swings, a slide and a climbing frame in the shape of a house. In Upper Tumble there is another park with picnic tables, benches, swings, a slide and two climbing frames, one shaped like a lorry and trailer and the other shaped like a house with a slide inside. Reclaimed Opencast mined land in the centre of the village has also been reseeded and planted with trees, thus enabling the local residents to use it for recreation and leisure pursuits. All the parks come under the control of Llanelli Borough Council.
